org.epochx.ge.op.init
Class GrowInitialiser

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.op.ConfigOperator<GEModel>
      org.epochx.ge.op.init.GrowInitialiser
All Implemented Interfaces:
GEInitialiser, ConfigListener, Listener, Initialiser, Operator
public class GrowInitialiser
extends ConfigOperator<GEModel>
implements GEInitialiser

Initialisation implementation which constructs each program's chromosome while ensuring that the parse tree it maps to is under the initial maximum depth limit. Each program generated with this initialiser will have a parse tree of a different depth. The depth of the parse tree is determined by a depth first mapping. Each codon is generated by randomly choosing a value up to the maximum codon value, which will provide the necessary production choice to construct the parse tree within the depth limitation.

If a model is provided then the following parameters are loaded upon every configure event:

  • population size
  • random number generator
  • grammar
  • maximum initial depth
  • maximum codon value

If the getModel method returns null then no model is set and whatever static parameters have been set as parameters to the constructor or using the standard accessor methods will be used. If any compulsory parameters remain unset when the initialiser is requested to generate new programs, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

See Also:
FixedLengthInitialiser, FullInitialiser, RampedHalfAndHalfInitialiser

GrowInitialiser

public GrowInitialiser(GEModel model)
Constructs a GrowInitialiser with the necessary parameters loaded from the given model. The parameters are reloaded on configure events. Duplicate programs are allowed in the populations that are constructed.

Parameters:
model - the GEModel instance from which the necessary parameters should be loaded.

GrowInitialiser

public GrowInitialiser(GEModel model,
                       boolean acceptDuplicates)
Constructs a GrowInitialiser with the necessary parameters loaded from the given model. The parameters are reloaded on configure events.

Parameters:
model - the GEModel instance from which the necessary parameters should be loaded.
acceptDuplicates - whether duplicates should be allowed in the populations that are generated.
Method Detail

onConfigure

public void onConfigure()
Description copied from class: ConfigOperator
Configures the operator with parameters from the model. This method will be called at the appropriate times to configure this component. Implementing classes should override this method to setup the operator with any parameters required from the model. If no model is set then this instance will not be subscribed to configure events and so alternative means must be used to configure it.

Specified by:
onConfigure in interface ConfigListener
Overrides:
onConfigure in class ConfigOperator<GEModel>

getInitialPopulation

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> getInitialPopulation()
Generates a population of new GECandidatePrograms constructed with a random sequence of codons such that they map to a parse tree of a depth at most equal to the max depth property. The size of the population will be equal to the population size attribute. All programs in the population are only guarenteed to be unique (as defined by the equals method on GECandidateProgram) if the isDuplicatesEnabled method returns true.

Specified by:
getInitialPopulation in interface GEInitialiser
Specified by:
getInitialPopulation in interface Initialiser
Returns:
A List of newly generated GECandidateProgram instances.

getInitialProgram

public GECandidateProgram getInitialProgram()
Constructs a new GECandidateProgram with a sequence of codons that map to a derivation tree using the currently set grammar which has a depth at most equal to the max depth property.

Returns:
a new GECandidateProgram instance.

isDuplicatesEnabled

public boolean isDuplicatesEnabled()
Returns whether or not duplicates are currently accepted or rejected from generated populations.

Returns:
true if duplicates are currently accepted in any populations generated by the getInitialPopulation method and false otherwise

setDuplicatesEnabled

public void setDuplicatesEnabled(boolean acceptDuplicates)
Sets whether duplicates should be allowed in the populations that are generated, or if they should be discarded.

Parameters:
acceptDuplicates - whether duplicates should be accepted in the populations that are constructed.

the rng the currently set random number generator.

setRNG

public void setRNG(RandomNumberGenerator rng)
Sets the random number generator to use. If a model has been set then this parameter will be overwritten with the random number generator from that model on the next configure event.

Parameters:
rng - the random number generator to set.

getGrammar

public Grammar getGrammar()
Returns the grammar that this initialiser is generating programs to satisfy. It is using this grammar that the initialiser will map the program's codons to determine the parse tree depth.

Returns:
the grammar that generated programs are being constructed for.

setGrammar

public void setGrammar(Grammar grammar)
Sets the grammar that should be used to determine which codons to use to create a program parse tree within the set depth limitations.

Parameters:
grammar - the Grammar that generated programs should be constructed for.

getPopSize

Returns the size of the populations that this initialiser constructs or -1 if none has been set.

the size of the populations that this initialiser will generate.

Sets the size of the populations that this initialiser should construct on calls to the getInitialPopulation method.

getMaxDepth

public int getMaxDepth()
Returns the maximum depth that any of the parse trees mapped from the codons of the programs generated by this initialiser should have.

Returns:
the maximum depth of the parse trees constructed.

Parameters:
